channel.title: Java Bug System
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [JDK-8336315] tools/jpackage/windows/WinChildProcessTest.java Failed: Check is calculator process is alive
item.description:
The following test failed in the JDK24 CI:

tools/jpackage/windows/WinChildProcessTest.java

Here's a snippet from the log file:

item.summary: tools/jpackage/windows/WinChildProcessTest.java Failed: Check is calculator process is alive

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/commit/2c9fd9016f4675448a62380ff2b86533020e690f

Spotted in the jdk-24+9-906-tier3 CI job set:

tools/jpackage/windows/WinChildProcessTest.java

https://mach5.us.oracle.com/mdash/jobs/mach5-one-jdk-24+9-906-tier3-20240727-1329-14502260/tasks/mach5-one-jdk-24+9-906-tier3-20240727-1329-14502260-open_test_jdk_tier3-windows-x64-408/results?search=%28%28status%3A%28failed%20OR%20FAILED%29%20AND%20-state%3Ainvalid%29%20OR%20%28status%3AEXECUTED_WITH_FAILURE%20AND%20taskType%3Abuild%20AND%20-state%3Ainvalid%29%29

https://mach5.us.oracle.com:10060/api/v1/results/mach5-one-jdk-24+9-906-tier3-20240727-1329-14502260-open_test_jdk_tier3-windows-x64-408-1722091718-1404/log

windows-x64: win11-x64-577512.mach5.javaplatfo1iad.oraclevcn.com

The test task's JVM args are: <none>

A pull request was submitted for review.
Branch: master
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/pull/20312
Date: 2024-07-24 12:20:05 +0000

[~vbp] Can you try the notepad?

If that didn't work I would adjust the test to make the ChildProcessAppLauncher class launch itself as a workload such that it never exits. This way we exclude 3rd party apps from the test.

You will need to rework ChildProcessAppLauncher class something like this:
---
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException, InterruptedException {
    if (args.length == 1 && "noexit".equals(args[0])) {
        var lock = new Object();
        synchronized (lock) {
            System.out.println("Process id=" + ProcessHandle.current().pid() + " is about to block");
            lock.wait();
        }
    } else {
        var childPath = System.getProperty("jpackage.app-path"); // get the path to the current jpackage app launcher
        ProcessBuilder processBuilder = new ProcessBuilder(childPath, "noexit");
        Process process = processBuilder.start();
        System.out.println("Child id=" + process.pid());
    }
}
---
[~vbp] Can you take a look at this regression? If you don't have a quick fix for this, please add the test to the problem list
It is a regression from JDK-8325525
